title: How are heaven and hell and who will certify those to be real? - Quora

response.answer_text: Heaven and hell can simply be compared and defined: In heaven, one lives eternally in the presence of Love. In hell, one lives eternally in the absence of Love. I don't know if we can truly imagine the dreadful reality of existing in the absence of love. Our creator of all things is Love. Yes, God is Love. And since love naturally allows the freedom to choose, love cannot/does not force anyone. Therefore, each human being decides, by our own will, our destiny — heaven or hell. We're told, “Eyes have not seen and ears have not heard the things the Lord has prepared for us (those who choose to accept the offered love of God).” No one could know this or even foolish enough to conjure up such thoughts. We had to be told by a self-revealing God. Though not a lot of detail is known about heaven, the record of origin gives us enough to await with great anticipation; yet, not enough to make us want to die to be with the Lord; and just in case, we are told to “choose life” — understood to mean, choose to remain alive. In the case of hell, we are given enough info so we are discouraged from going there. No one will have an escuse to reject the forgiveness of sins, therefore choosing condemnation. Heaven and hell are places, but where are they? Though many have made suggestions, that's all they are — just suggestions. We know that the “Heavenly Jerusalem” will descend from heaven and will “settle” over the current Jerusalem in Israel. God's people (made so by the sacrificial death of Messiah Jesus) who once lived in time, throughout the ages, will descend from heaven along with Jesus and the New Jerusalem. What I and all Believers do, and the responsibilities we are given, only gets better from there. Some believe that hell — the place reserved for the eternal punishment of Satan and all who sides with him — is located in the center of the earth. But hell's location is not revealed. We know from the word of God that all humans will be given a body that will exist forever — in heaven or hell. For the sinful body we now live in cannot exist in God's holy presence; neither can it withstand the eternal suffering of the fire and agony humans have chosen for themselves. Our presence in heaven and hell will certify its reality. Meanwhile, let's not forget that God is love and do not wish for any to perish. That's why Jesus saves.

There is a scripture that early Christian writings used to signify that hell isnt eternal but an age after an age. Theyve been taught that hell is eternal which isnt compatible with Gods nature. The early church father Origin introduced doctrines of everyone being saved. The latin church leaders didnt agree with this and they were the ones that influenced the bible being translated into its current translation. The other schools of early Christian thought believed that people would be punished by hell but not cast out forever and condemned to an eternity there. In my opinion that more lines up with the truth of Gods judgment.
